problem_text: All mammals are animals. All monkeys are mammals. An animal is either a monkey or a bird. All birds fly. All animals breathe. If something can fly, then it has wings. If Rock is neither a fly nor a bird, then Rock neither flies nor breathes.
predicates:
Animal(x) ::: x is an animal.
Mammal(x) ::: x is a mammal.
Monkey(x) ::: x is a monkey.
Bird(x) ::: x is a bird.
Flies(x) ::: x flies.
Breathes(x) ::: x breathes.
HasWings(x) ::: x has wings.
Rock ::: Rock.

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Rock is an animal, then Rock is a bird.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Rock is an animal.
tests.conclusions: Animal(Rock) ::: Rock is an animal. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Rock is a mammal, then Rock is a bird.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Rock breathes.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Rock is not an animal, then Rock is a monkey.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? Rock is a monkey.
tests.conclusions: Monkey(Rock) ::: Rock is a monkey. FALSE

tests.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Rock is a bird, then Rock flies.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If Rock flies, then Rock is a bird.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If an animal breathes, then it is either a monkey or a bird.
Based on the above information, is the following statement true or false? If something is an animal, then it either has wings or it is a monkey.

candidate_solutions.text:
# Predicates:
Animal(x) ::: x is an animal.
Mammal(x) ::: x is a mammal.
Monkey(x) ::: x is a monkey.
Bird(x) ::: x is a bird.
Flies(x) ::: x flies.
Breathes(x) ::: x breathes.
HasWings(x) ::: x has wings.
Rock ::: Rock.

# Premises:
∀x (Mammal(x) → Animal(x)) ::: All mammals are animals.
∀x (Monkey(x) → Mammal(x)) ::: All monkeys are mammals.
∀x (Animal(x) → (Monkey(x) ∨ Bird(x))) ::: An animal is either a monkey or a bird.
∀x (Bird(x) → Flies(x)) ::: All birds fly.
∀x (Animal(x) → Breathes(x)) ::: All animals breathe.
∀x (Flies(x) → HasWings(x)) ::: If something can fly, then it has wings.
¬Flies(rock) ∧ ¬Bird(rock) → (¬Flies(rock) ∧ ¬Breathes(rock)) ::: If Rock is neither a fly nor a bird, then Rock neither flies nor breathes.

# Predicates:

∀x (Flies(x) → HasWings(x)) ::: If something can fly, then it has wings.

(¬Flies(rock) ∧ ¬Bird(rock)) → ¬(Flies(rock) ∨ Breathes(rock)) ::: If Rock is neither a fly nor a bird, then Rock neither flies nor breathes.

validation.questions: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? Rock is a monkey.
validation.conclusions: Monkey(rock) ::: Rock is a monkey. unknown
